Too expensive (almost $10 a bag), doesn't cover much area, and too lightweight.  It would have blown away had we not covered it with the nugget mulch.  The only thing that this could be used for best would be in planters.
reviews.author: Fancy

reviews.title: "Love this product!!!!!!!!!!"
reviews.text: Love the look, just wish it wasn't so expensive, but in the long run it's a small price to pay. My wood mulch had mushroom fungus and looked disgusting. I don't ever want to have to deal with that again and the rubber mulch is the perfect solution.
reviews.author: Emmeyk

reviews.title: "this is great!"
reviews.text: This shredded rubber mulch is great!!!! I use in my flower beds and landscaping. It last a long time. Don't have to change or replenish offend. Can leave down. It comes in brown or black, does not fade or change colors. I like this better then the wood mulch. The wood mulch you have to change out offend or every year. Easy to put down. It keep the weed out and it don't attack bugs.
reviews.author: laugh

reviews.title: "Rubber Mulch"
reviews.text: I was reccomend to use rubber mulch didn't have a clue what the difference was but I'm glad I switched. During a heavy storm it stayed in place which made me happy. Love it!
reviews.author: Lynne

reviews.title: "No Worry Mulch"
reviews.text: I needed a mulch for a small area next to the house, but didn't want a wood mulch that would promote termite activity.   This mulch was a great solution.   However, there is a rubber smell which I think will disappear.   I used the mulch at the back of the house and only notice the odor when I walk in front of it.
reviews.author: Dii

reviews.title: "Great Stuff!"
reviews.text: Rubberific Brown Rubber Mulch shredded looks like wood mulch. I purchased the brown which I especially like for its deep, dark color! Looks great! The only downside so far was the cost! Bought the bulk pallet and still needed more... Hopefully it will maintain its color 5-6 years. I would definitely buy it again!
reviews.author: Wbwheel

reviews.title: "Good product with one flaw."
reviews.text: Product is easy to walk o, looks good and tends to stay put for the most part. The only complaint I have is that the shredded rubber has a lot of white paper mixed in. I'm guessing that this is fromm stickers and labels on the tire before shredding. I ended up picking a good bit of paper out after spreading.
reviews.author: Bud

reviews.title: "Red Mulch"
reviews.text: It is a good filler around the swimming pool so grass won't grow next to the pool. It looks good. It's great in flower beds next to the house and being rubber it will not rot like wood mulch and will not attract termites.
reviews.author: Yogi

reviews.title: "Looks like real mulch"
reviews.text: This looks really nice. Like hardwood mulch. Not like rocks or Stone. If contained properly it should last forever. I like it a lot.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Great!!"
reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters play area. It works great. This stuff will make the impact of a fall less damaging. Highly recommend
reviews.author: Jj

reviews.title: "I love this mulch"
reviews.text: This is by far the best mulch I have ever used. It keeps its dark color for years. My dogs have no interest in eating it like they did the other kind of mulch I've bought in the past. A bag of this does not go far and it is more costly to use initially but it will last for a long, long time.
reviews.author: Tholi

reviews.title: "Great Product"
reviews.text: This rubber mulch is great! Looks Fantastic and lasts a long time. Makes your house look new and well designed. It may be more exspensive per bag, but do the math over a twelve year period. I hope Lowes carrires this in Spring of 2016 because I would like to do the rest of my yard!
reviews.author: PaulL

reviews.title: "Great mulch choice"
reviews.text: I purchased this mulch to top off a faux tree that I placed in a pot. Very pleased with the finish look.
reviews.author: Jazzy

reviews.title: "Bugs seem to hate it!  That's a good thing"
reviews.text: We used this in a few flower beds and really like it.  The rubber holds it's color very well, doesn't hold moisture and thus doesn't attract bugs.  It's pretty wind proof.  Maybe a tad pricey but you're not going to have to replace it very often.  Pretty much maintenance free.
reviews.author: Hammerhead

reviews.title: "Stinks"
reviews.text: It may last 10 years but my yard smells like rubber. I am having it taken out and cedar put back in.
reviews.author: dhanke

reviews.title: "Best Rubber Mulch"
reviews.text: I was happy with the quality of the mulch and its size is perfect for playground..
reviews.author: JorgeS

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: The cost is much higher compared to a similar size bag of regular mulch, but this is heavier, will maintain color for years, and should save a lot of money long-term. Would highly recommend buying this and doing mulch once vs buying new mulch every 1-2 years.
reviews.author: BarneySmitty

reviews.title: "Just as good as the natural mulch!"
reviews.text: I recently completed some landscaping on my home, removed weeds and some old mulch, and applied Rubberific Red Mulch!  The mulch gives it a more updated and refreshing look.  I've purchased about 8 bags of this mulch to keep the weeds down.  So far so good!
reviews.author: AllAboutImproving

reviews.title: "My Go-To Mulch"
reviews.text: This mulch look great and good value.
reviews.author: TAH

reviews.title: "This product delivers"
reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this product a year ago to mulch two new beds. It looks exactly like wood mulch and a year later looks like we just put it down. We liked it so much we bought another 25 bags for a new bed we planted together.
reviews.author: Karen

reviews.title: "Easy"
reviews.text: Use it around my pool, it's shredded and not chunks (so it's not a missile if ya hit it with the mower!). Easy to transport, to put down and there is no maintenance. Does not attract bugs or fade. What's not to like?
reviews.author: Stu

reviews.title: "Not enough!!!"
reviews.text: I bought this for under my kids' rainbow swingset/treehouse.... Its awesome but i bought a total of 13 bags and um, yeah, its not enough. Id say buy REAL MULCH IN BULK FIRST, thennnnn put this stuff ontop... At least 15 bags would be good after real mulch ;) its def cool i like it but i still need a lot more :(
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Rubber mulch"
reviews.text: I use it in my backyard I made a walkway to my gate and I use it in between the pavers that I placed down it looks beautiful I also add it to mine flower garden this is really great I like it keeps out the bugs and weeds and it lasts for a long time I use this before in my front yard and it's been there for five or six seven years I haven't replaced the front yard and it still looks great I recommend this better than the regular mulch
reviews.author: Joy

reviews.title: "This is mulch made of rubber."
reviews.text:
This is mulch made of rubber! It is not made of wood. It's a good mulch. It's a little more expensive than the rubber mulch that Home Depot used to carry, but since Lowes is the only store that has it, I recommend this rubber mulch from lowes.
I do not recommend this product if you are allergic to rubber.
reviews.author: LizKN

reviews.title: "Best mulch ever"
reviews.text: No bugs, no weeds, retains moisture, light weight, used it for years.  I'm re-landscaping my front yard and wanted to replace my old rubber mulch.  I've used it for years and would never use anything else.
reviews.author: DottieR

reviews.title: "Rubber Mulch"
reviews.text: Tried rubber mulch for the first time last year. Some guy asked me if I ever used it before and I told him no. I said I'm taking the risk vs the wood mulch that doesn't look as nice after a bit. Good thing I took that risk. I enjoy using rubber mulch because it retains its color for years as opposed to wood mulch which loses its color before a year. It looks very similar to the blend I used to use. The only gripe about the rubber mulch is that I wish it came in 1 cu bags. Would make filling my mulching areas a whole lot easier and less bags to purchase.
reviews.author: JD

reviews.title: "It's worth it, unfortunately"
reviews.text: I excavated a 200 sqft (6" deep) section of the back yard for my son's Swing set. You basically have 3 options, rubber tiles, rubber mulch, or liquid rubber that pours like concrete. Rubber mulch is the cheapest option and still looks really good. The red looks great and keeps its color for 10 years. Only downside is I ended up having to buy 3x as many bags as I thought I'd need. In the end, this project probably takes 80 bags.
reviews.author: Jarrod

reviews.title: "Lasts for many years"
reviews.text: The color does not fade or wash out like wood mulch. This mulch will not blow away due to its weight. I wish the price could be lowered so I could afford larger areas that need mulch.
reviews.author: gardengal

reviews.title: "Good Rubber Bark for raised beds."
reviews.text: This works well for mulching raised beds as well as for paths around stepping stones.Stays put in wind and rain.Bought a lot of this over the last 3 years for different projects.
reviews.author: Tom1

reviews.title: "Best mulch ever"
reviews.text: Up front cost is higher but since it does not deteriate it does not need replacing. Also bugs will not live in it thus reducing bugs that could get into the home
reviews.author: Ron

reviews.title: "Much Better than Wood Mulch"
reviews.text: It cost a little more than the wood mulch, but it is much easier to spread and the color has not faded. I plan to use around all by shrubs. Great product.
reviews.author: Thomas

reviews.title: "I love this stuff!!"
reviews.text: I love using this mulch  it's easy to spread, retains it's color and is bug free. We have had a lot of rain and the mulch has stayed right where I put it.
reviews.author: Sue

reviews.title: "A decent substitute..."
reviews.text: ...for regular mulch. Time will tell if it holds up. At $10 for a smaller bag, it should last a minimum of 6 years to be cost-effective!
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Carefree Mulch"
reviews.text: I prefer rubber mulch to natural mulch.It doesn't attract bugs,looks great,doesn't fade,& holds up very well to heavy rain downpours.
reviews.author: Chas

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: Great product!  Keeps your weeds out of sight. The best part is that you don't have to replace it next spring. It keeps going.
reviews.author: Tin

reviews.title: "Great Purchase"
reviews.text: Great idea for mulch. color is lasting. Easy to put out. Doesn't wash easily
reviews.author: coach

reviews.title: "Rubber Biscuits!"
reviews.text: It feels good to recycle. And, well this stuff lays like real mulch, but better. It's heavy so it lays nicely. I used it recently, so colorfastness is unknown and how it stays in place is only guess. I couldn't tell you this stuff is rubber and not real mulch because it really looks just like mulch. I can't stress that enough. And as for reviews stating they had trash mixed in, I did not with 12 bags. I did see one tie wrap, and one cigarette butt (painted red). By the way, the "red" appeared near brown to me, just lighter than the brown option.
reviews.author: Jen

reviews.title: "shredded rubber mulch"
reviews.text: I absolutely love it. It spreads easily and stays put. And it's so cushy, even to kneel on.
reviews.author: cajunlady

reviews.title: "Perfect for our landscaping"
reviews.text: Covers large area and stays put even through the heavy raining we have received lately.
reviews.author: Amber

reviews.title: "Rubber mulch"
reviews.text: Looks like wood mulch, good coverage. Too bad it's not available at my local store!

reviews.title: "Do it once or do it over and over again"
reviews.text: For many years I did the wood mulch thing in the Spring like so many home owners. Followed by the mulch fading within a few short months. One time it was less than a month that the wood mulch faded. The following year adding yet more mulch to cover for the color fade and freshen it up and then typically within 2-3 years we would have to dig the beds up as they were too full of faded mulch. Factoring in the cost to do, redo, and dig it up and yet redo again we realize that it was costing us a lot for mulch and the loss of time. Not to mention there are disclaimers not to use wood mulch against building since oÃ²insects are attracted to the wood. No more red hands, no more color fade and no more bug worries. Sure it cost a pretty penny to lanscape the entire yard in rubber mulch but at 43 the last thing I want to be doing is mulching every Spring or getting raked over the coals by a landscaper here in nj.

Excellent product! Lasts for years, the color does not fade and it doesn't break down. It does not have to be replaced every year like regular mulch. Great for children's play areas.
The first time we purchased this product was twelve years ago. It looks as good today as it did when we first put it down.

For me this is the perfect mulch.

reviews.title: "Worth the money!"

reviews.text: I love the rubber mulch. It is very very light which helps with my back but your hands don't get dirty either. The only complaint I have is the cost. It is double the cost over the wood mulch. Also Im not yet sure about the color duration. Only put it out a couple of weeks ago.

reviews.title: "Pros and Cons if rubber mulch"

reviews.text: Put in a flower bed to dress it up and itLooks great! KeepsWeeds at bay as well. Very happy I found this.

reviews.author: pkdoane

reviews.title: "BUYER BEWARE"
reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE... Make sure to purchase all of this brown rubber mulch at one time, from the same store and off the same pallet. The brown color and the shred size varies greatly from one batch to another batch. I purchased 45 bags of this brown rubber mulch from the same Lowe's store, but during several trips. The first 40 bags are a much larger shred size and an orange brown color. The last 5 bags are a very fine shred and more of a black brown color. I've traveled to 4 different Lowe's stores to try to find more that matches the 40 bags that are already in my flower beds, with no luck. Contact Customer Service at the manufacturer, sent pictures to them and now I have to send them samples to prove that the bags of mulch don't match. Spent $340.00 and now I cannot locate any matching mulch. Tried to post pictures, but this site would not post the pictures.
reviews.author: Michael

reviews.text: The product was easy to use. I simply opened the bag and poured the product onto the ground; it was easily spread using a garden rake. I miscalculated the amount I needed, so I definitely plan to purchase more bags to complete the job, even though I felt the product was overpriced.

reviews.title: "Shredded Rubber Mulch"
reviews.text: Great product that never needs replacing.  So far I thoroughly enjoy the rubber mulch.  Coupled with a protective layer underneath I have had no grass or weeds pop up and the color has remained the same as when purchased.  The price per bag is a little steep especially when it only covers such a small area, however, never having to repeat or reapply the process is very enticing.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Cautious"
reviews.text: Purchased a lot of this mulch. It is expensive. It looks real. I was a little cautious because it is rubber. It is permanent. Not sure how it will overwinter, and not sure how spreading plants will react to it. Again, it's permanent. If it doesn't look good next year, there is only one way to get rid of it. Only gave 3 stars because I do not know the answers to my own questions.
reviews.author: RobL

reviews.title: "Blowing into yard"
reviews.text: The slightest wind moves this mulch around which I  was told wouldn't  happen. I bought 90 bags 2 years ago and now have to replace at least 40 bags. I'm going back to wooden mulch at 1/4 of the price!!
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Best mulch I've ever bought"
reviews.text: Rubber mulch has done a great job of holding in moisture and discouraging weeds. Best of all, it didn't wash away in heavy rains like my shredded bark mulch did. It does smell like rubber for a couple of weeks but that goes away. So far it has maintained its red color. It hasn't faded. It looks great and does the job of mulch in preserving moisture and preventing weeds.
reviews.author: Mary

reviews.title: "Love it"

reviews.title: "I like the Rubberific mulch after 1 month."
reviews.text: I was dreading putting mulch down AGAIN (regular mulch lasts 1 year, 2 years is pushing it), and found this stuff. It really looks like real mulch and went down really easy. bags smaller and lighter than regular mulch. The cost is about 3x regular mulch, but if it lasts 12 years as advertised I am ahead of the game. It is made from recycled tires, I didn't find any wire or junk in my bags. I bought 15 bags. I liked that it will thwart insects as this I put it several feet from a part cedar/part brick house. There is a slight rubbery smell,  for the first week or so but goes away, although you don't smell rubber when you initially put it down. It's been a month and it still looks great. Actually looks better than the bags of regular mulch (I have found sometimes the regular dark brown mulch has 5 to 10% white spots on it). It was about $9.99 a bag. I'm liking it so far, especially since it looks better and was easier to apply. I got the dark brown color. Hopefully, my nephew in 2nd grade will be close to graduating high school until I have to redo this.
reviews.author: ChrisF

reviews.title: "A Better Mulch"

questions.question: "Does this product wash away in heavy rains?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: thesodfather
answers.text: If your area of application is near gutter downspouts it will wash away. To minimize loss you can implement a pave stone weeping wall or run a downspout extension which would also resolve drainage issues.

answers.author: Oscarito
answers.text: NO!

answers.author: Amy7735
answers.text: I have had this product for over a year now and have not noticed any loss in wind or heavy rain.

answers.author: Connie
answers.text: It does NOT wash away. It stays put nicely, unless you're talking about huge "flooding" rains! I have used it all last summer and it is still all intact, and we had some nasty thunderstorms. Doesn't even remotely compare to the wood mulch, which seems to disappear every time I look. Looks great, I will NEVER again buy the cheaper wood mulch. RUBBER mulch all the way!

answers.author: Concon
answers.text: Mine has not washed away

answers.author: tylerdhurst
answers.text: It will if you don't put a boarder around it.

questions.question: "Will the smell of rubber , come in the house from the a/c ?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: CindyC-M
answers.text: Initially had a rubber smell for only few hours, no smell now!

answers.author: jackofallmasterofnone
answers.text: no it only smells of rubber for the first couple of days

answers.author: Jennifer
answers.text: You cannot not even smell it when I sit on my front porch! So I seriously doubt it will!

answers.author: JSwogger
answers.text: If you have central air it shouldn't unless you have a high efficiency system that pulls outside air. Most older systems just use the air from inside your home. If you have a window unit and it is in close proximity to your mulch it may. The smell goes away fairly quickly though.

answers.author: James19
answers.text: We put this mulch all around our house and property and had zero rubber smell come in the house and I hardly ever even had the smell outside. I think you will really like this product.

answers.author: iluvcocacola
answers.text: Other than the smell of rubber as we were originally putting the mulch down, we have not had any smell from it either in the house or outside. To answer your specific question, we do have the mulch right at the air conditioning unit and there is not a smell from it. I highly recommend it, it is holding up well.

answers.author: Markus
answers.text: I would agree with the color assessment of middle-of-the-road to darkish red.

answers.author: joanmaarie
answers.text: This mulch is a deep red. Not bright and garish, more like red wine.

answers.author: tazzhd
answers.text: Best advice, go to the store and look at it. If the color does not match well enough you could always put a thin (cost effective) layer over the existing mulch.

answers.author: TrishB
answers.text: I have a pic attached to my review of my use of this product. The picture is pretty clear and gives a great view of the vibrant color of the mulch....hope its helps you out and good luck with your project!

answers.author: Zhayes
answers.text: The color is not bright. It is a medium shade of red. The color of this mulch is great, and when you first pour the mulch it looks like a bright red, but after 1 day the color fades into a softer red.

answers.author: BonnieP
answers.text: it is "redwood" red

questions.question: "Do you need to put anything under the rubber mulch before laying it down?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: WildBill
answers.text: I saved old cardboard boxes, cut them into the sizes I needed, soaked them down with water, and placed them on top of the grass around the shrubs and shrub bed I wanted to cover. I then placed the rubber mulch on top of the cardboard. The mulch is heavy enough to hold down the cardboard and I haven't had any grass or weeds show, and it's been 6 months. You can find various videos on YouTube.

answers.author: Smitty
answers.text: Not necessarily, but you will get a neater appearance if you use landscape fabric and cut openings for your plants and beds. Also, coverage is better with landscape fabric, which means you can use less mulch, which is an important factor considering the expense of rubber mulch.

answers.author: linda
answers.text: No. I had some regular mulch down and got most of that up. I left a level of reg. mulch down. Mistake. The squirrel's dig holes to find their nuts and there threw up some of the old mulch. I just fill in the little holes and put another layer of rubber mulch down

answers.author: JSwogger
answers.text: You don't need to but would recommend putting down landscape fabric so you don't get weeds.

answers.author: iluvcocacola
answers.text: We put it directly over our old, traditional mulch, but if this going over a new area I would recommend putting down plastic film first for weeds. BTW, we have had a problem in the past with mulch color fading, this mulch has stood up very well.

answers.author: James19
answers.text: If you are starting a new mulch area, I would still lay down some landscape cloth. The rubber mulch is great, but it will still allow weeds to grow.

questions.question: "What is the difference with Rubberific @ $9.87 a bag & Replay @ $7.58 a bag?"
questions.author: 11Okie

answers.author: jglz
answers.text: Rubberific has a very good quality and rubbers are clean, Replay and others providers the rubbers (Mulch) are dirty and bad design of the mulch. (too big to be a mulch on Replay and others)

answers.author: dw99
answers.text: I've used both. Mainly the shape of the pieces. The Rubberlific is more the equivelent of "shredded mulch" while the Replay is in "chunks". I believe that the Rubberlific tends to stay in place a bit better and seems to not get kicked around by our dogs as much. I doesn't have to be that think, but whenever I've put it down thinner I tend to get the fabric or plastic showing through because it shifts, etc.

answers.author: iluvcocacola
answers.text: Rubberific is made of recycled tires and I believe that the rubber will last for years. It is like the rubber used on some playgrounds. I think that 2 inches would be quite thick.

answers.author: James19
answers.text: Rubberific looks like real landscape mulch. Replay is more chunky and great for playgrounds. If you are mulching for looks, go with Rubberific. We did not go 2 inches, more like one. The wind does not blow Rubberific around.

answers.author: Dayoffyardaholic
answers.text: replay is chunky pieces of rubber and rubberiffic is shredded rubber

answers.author: robertdustoffe
answers.text: Only difference I can tell is that Rubberific seems to be more consistent on sizing. Anything less than 2" thick would not be a good UV blocker; but you can try less, always add more later.

questions.question: "Anyone know if this is safe around dogs? What if they eat one?"
questions.author: catleo

answers.author: Bryan
answers.text: It is not specifically non-toxic as it is made from rcycled tires. Don't think it would be a tasty snack for dogs, but I'm no vet. I know dogs have lived through worse.

answers.author: Connie
answers.text: It IS safe around pets! My dog wouldn't eat rubber mulch but I can't speak for yours. I don't believe dogs would find it very palatable.

answers.author: tylerdhurst
answers.text: my dogs use the bathroom on this. that was my plan from the beginning. I would assume it's not very good if they eat it as it's recycled rubber and probably contains chemicals you don't want in your dog. However if they eat a piece, I'm pretty sure it wouldn't be fatal. to be safe, be a good owner and watch your dog so they don't eat any!

answers.author: Drock
answers.text: Dogs do eat anything, try something else.

answers.author: Dayoffyardaholic
answers.text: Most dogs wont eat rubber but if they do i would induce vomiting rigth away

answers.author: robertdustoffe
answers.text: It will pass intact, been there seen that.--Dog OK

questions.question: "How does it hold up to mold or mildew. My location does not get much sun. Alway washing porch because of green mold/mildew."
questions.author: rk

answers.author: Drock
answers.text: Mold on tires nah, they hate tire rubber.

answers.author: Nancy
answers.text: Have never had a problem with mold or mildew.

answers.author: iluvcocacola
answers.text: Interesting question that I had not thought of, even though I have the same issue with mold/mildew on my deck that I have to pressure wash often. We have not had any mold/mildew or fungus problems in the mulch.

answers.author: James19
answers.text: We have not had it down long, but the Rubberific says that it will not rot or decay.

answers.author: Dayoffyardaholic
answers.text: I personally have never seen this product mildew or gain mold.As far as the mildew try a little bleach on the area affected

answers.author: Moo-Mobile
answers.text: I have this mulch around a landscaped pond area that I water allot. I have not had any problem with mold or mildue.

questions.question: "Blowing leaves off- does it stay in place?"
questions.author: mom

answers.author: iluvcocacola
answers.text: I take care to blow across the top of the mulch, not aiming the airflow directly into the mulch, but it is heavy enough to stay in place pretty well.

answers.author: Dayoffyardaholic
answers.text: I use a blower regularly, but i lightly go over the area.It is heavy enuff to stay on the ground with out too much blowing around. I live in a windy part of vegas and this stuff doesnt go anywhere.

answers.author: Vicki
answers.text: Unfortuantely the mulch doesn't stay to well when up against a leaf blower; be prepared to pick some of it up.

answers.author: squareroundpeg
answers.text: This stuff is very light...most likely would easily blow with a leaf blower's gust.

answers.author: Kris
answers.text: It will blow away with the leaves if you are using a leaf blower.

answers.author: pogo5816
answers.text: Assuming that the leaves aren't under the mulch, it should be fine. The leaves are lighter than the mulch so the mulch should stay put.

questions.question: "safe for pets?have a dog that eats regular mulch and rocks,"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: LizKN
answers.text: Your dog will most likely eat this mulch as well, my Brother's dog eats both :)

answers.author: PJQuilts
answers.text: It's rubber and has the rubber smell. My dog doesn't bother it.

answers.author: dbj9171
answers.text: This is as safe as any other rubber product. Would your dog eat anything else made of rubber? The smell of this may detract from the dog thinking it is edible.

answers.author: woody
answers.text: cleaner then regular mulch for animals..they don't do their business on it or eat it.

answers.author: BonnieP
answers.text: I didn't put mine down in the dogs area-mine eat mulch also and I didn't really want them eating RUBBER

questions.question: "I want to put something down on dirt so that my dogs don't kick up so much dust, and don't get so dirty. Is this a good choice?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Connie
answers.text: Yes. It's a great choice, but I would still use a landscape fabric underneath the mulch. It will keep weeds out AND keep the dust down!

answers.author: tylerdhurst
answers.text: I put landscapping fabric down because after about a week the grass started coming through. The one thing you might watch out for is instead of dust, you'll be kicking up bits of rubber mulch if you get to rowdy in the mulch.

answers.author: perkyshrew
answers.text: These are great for that, my dog loves rolling and running in them. We hit the dirt real good with Preen for weed control but skipped putting fabric down.

answers.author: Drock
answers.text: Questionable, though dogs eat anything, weeds do grow through add a weed sheeting product.

answers.author: iluvcocacola
answers.text: We've had it down for a year now and are quite happy with the way that it has held up and held its color. Not having dogs, I don't know if they would "go" in it, or continue to use the yard area, but if they did go in the mulch it would be quite a problem to clean up. We put it down over old style mulch, without using plastic or anything under it and did not have weed problems.
